message.content:
We must “build” (by hand‐reading the rows) the set of transactions that change the “Accounts Receivable” balance. In our system sales that are not collected “in cash” instead use “Account Receviable” as the receive method. (We ignore transactions such as interest receivables or those with other methods.) In our problem the only increases to AR come from Sales with a “receive_method” equal to “Account Receviable”. (No cash “collections” are shown for AR so we assume no offsetting decrease.) 

Step‐by‑step we scan the sales rows where the “receive_method” field is “Account Receviable” and note the “after_tax_amount” (the sales revenue recognized in AR). In our data these are (shown with approximate values):

1. Sale20240102001: 16,095.47 
2. Sale20240102002: 22,557.80 
3. Sale20240103003: 1,184.17 
4. Sale20240104007: 19,200.11 
5. Sale20240105010: 4,895.99 
6. Sale20240110028: 1,762.35 
7. Sale20240110029: 18,713.48 
8. Sale20240111030: 937.06 
9. Sale20240113038: 8,041.76 
10. Sale20240115045: 6,771.80 
11. Sale20240115047: 1,731.58 
12. Sale20240116049: 2,665.34 
13. Sale20240117051: 23,812.46 
14. Sale20240119058: 438.71 
15. Sale20240119058 (continuing; next AR row): 3,419.30 
16. Sale20240119058 (next AR row): 4,910.28 
17. Sale20240119058 (another AR row): 613.32 
18. Sale20240121064: 14,318.25 
19. Sale20240122067: 21,978.89 
20. Sale20240122069: 1,213.20 
21. Sale20240125079: 35,274.97 
22. Sale20240125081: 1,041.54 
23. Sale20240126084: 1,420.63 
24. Sale20240127089: 38,449.68 
25. Sale20240127090: 13,179.88 
26. Sale20240129097: 1,997.44 
27. Sale20240129099: 15,933.26 
28. Sale20240131106: 233.95 
29. Sale20240201108: 4,859.33 
30. Sale20240201109: 3,736.44 
31. Sale20240201110: 627.26 
32. Sale20240130103: 1,434.89 

When we add all of these “after tax” amounts, we get:

  16,095.47 + 22,557.80 + 1,184.17 + 19,200.11 + 4,895.99 + 1,762.35 + 18,713.48 + 937.06 + 8,041.76 + 6,771.80 + 1,731.58 + 2,665.34 + 23,812.46 + 438.71 + 3,419.30 + 4,910.28 + 613.32 + 14,318.25 + 21,978.89 + 1,213.20 + 35,274.97 + 1,041.54 + 1,420.63 + 38,449.68 + 13,179.88 + 1,997.44 + 15,933.26 + 233.95 + 4,859.33 + 3,736.44 + 627.26 + 1,434.89 = 292,450.59

This “balance” represents the ending Accounts Receivable from the sales that have not been collected in cash. (In the cash‐flow statement an increase in AR is shown as a use of cash; therefore, it is “subtracted”.)

Thus the “(Increase) Decrease in Accounts Receivable” item is –292,450.59.

We now present the answer in the required JSON format.

Final answer:
--------------------------------------------------

{
  "solution": {
    "(Increase) Decrease in Accounts Receivable": "-292450.59"
  }
}
